greektext:
Greek text in Unicode

base edition: ed. pr.
author: anon.
contents: commentary on the final part of Iliad 10 (with selected lemmata), mainly related to the killing of Rhesus. The text shows similarities with P.Mich.inv. 1315 and the Homeric scholia.
propernames: Menelaos (2); Euphorbos (R); Patroklos (R); Atreus (R, Q); Dolôn; Rhêsos; Hektôr (1 + R); Zeus (Q, R); Trôes [Trojans] (2Q); Diomêdês (R, Q).
mythological: Menelaos (2); Euphorbos (R); Patroklos (R); Atreus (R, Q); Dolôn; Rhêsos; Hektôr (1 + R; Zeus (Q, R); Trôes [Trojans] (2Q); Diomêdês (R, Q).
statepreservation: washed-off remains of 25 lines, broken off on both sides, probably from the top of a column.
hand: small, informal, round, upright, generally bilinear, fairly regular, written by a proficient scribe, well separating the letters, with occasional links, some letters decorated with small serifs; the lines are closely spaced.
